diabetes_in_india.definition: Diabetes is a chronic disease that occurs when the pancreas does not produce enough insulin or when the body cannot effectively use the insulin it produces.

description.insulin_role: Insulin is a hormone that regulates blood sugar.
description.hyperglycaemia: Raised blood sugar, common effect of uncontrolled diabetes that leads to serious damage to the body's systems.

neuropathy.description: Nerve damage that increases the chance of foot ulcers and infections.

diabetic_retinopathy.description: Accumulated damage to small blood vessels in the retina.

kidney_failure.description: Diabetes is among the leading causes of kidney failure.
